meanings.definition: The process of becoming or causing to become wrinkled or shriveled.
meanings.sent1: After leaving the apple out for too long, I noticed the crenation on its skin.
meanings.sent2: The crenation of the paper edges made it look old and worn.
meanings.sent3: The crenation on the dried leaves made them look like tiny crumpled maps.
meanings.sent4: The crenation of the fabric resembled the waves of the ocean during a storm.
meanings.sent5: The crenation of the flower petals added a unique texture to the bouquet.

meanings.definition: A small notch or rounded projection on the edge of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The crenation on the roof tiles helped with water drainage.
meanings.sent2: I ran my finger along the crenation of the wooden railing.
meanings.sent3: The crenation on the cookie cutter gave the cookies a decorative edge.
meanings.sent4: The crenation on the bookshelf provided a stylish touch to the room.
meanings.sent5: The crenation on the pottery added a charming detail to the vase.
